segment.source: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM
segment.target: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM

segment.source: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM
segment.target: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM

segment.source: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM
segment.target: Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM

segment.source: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.
segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) mounts a Windows image (.wim) file or virtual hard disk (.vhd or .vhdx) for servicing.

segment.source: You can also use the DISM image management command to list the image index numbers or to verify the architecture for the image that you are mounting.
segment.target: You can also use the DISM image management command to list the image index numbers or to verify the architecture for the image that you are mounting.

segment.source: After you update the image, you must unmount it and either commit or discard the changes you have made.
segment.target: After you update the image, you must unmount it and either commit or discard the changes you have made.

segment.source: You can use DISM servicing commands to install, uninstall, configure, and update the features and packages in offline Windows® images and offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) images.
segment.target: You can use DISM servicing commands to install, uninstall, configure, and update the features and packages in offline Windows® images and offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) images.

segment.source: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.
segment.target: For more information about common DISM scenarios, see What is DISM?.

segment.source: For more information about DISM servicing commands, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about DISM servicing commands, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: Capture Images of Hard Disk Partitions Using DISM
segment.target: Capture Images of Hard Disk Partitions Using DISM

segment.source: Use the Diskpart tool and the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to capture an image and save it as a .wim file.
segment.target: Use the Diskpart tool and the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool to capture an image and save it as a .wim file.

segment.source: Mount and Modify a Windows Image Using DISM
segment.target: Mount and Modify a Windows Image Using DISM

segment.source: Map the contents of a Windows image (.wim) file to a directory to service the image or to perform common file operations such as adding and deleting files.
segment.target: Map the contents of a Windows image (.wim) file to a directory to service the image or to perform common file operations such as adding and deleting files.

segment.source: Apply Images Using DISM
segment.target: Apply Images Using DISM

segment.source: Use the Diskpart tool and the DISM tool to apply Windows images to one or more partitions onto a computer for deployment.
segment.target: Use the Diskpart tool and the DISM tool to apply Windows images to one or more partitions onto a computer for deployment.

segment.source: Split a Windows Image (WIM) File to Span Across Multiple DVDs
segment.target: Split a Windows Image (WIM) File to Span Across Multiple DVDs

segment.source: Split a large .wim file into several smaller files that will fit on your selected media.
segment.target: Split a large .wim file into several smaller files that will fit on your selected media.

segment.source: Copy split .wim files onto your selected media as .iso files.
segment.target: Copy split .wim files onto your selected media as .iso files.

segment.source: Create a WIM for Multiple Architecture Types Using DISM
segment.target: Create a WIM for Multiple Architecture Types Using DISM

segment.source: Create a single .wim file that includes both 32-bit and 64-bit Windows images.
segment.target: Create a single .wim file that includes both 32-bit and 64-bit Windows images.

segment.source: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM
segment.target: Append a Volume Image to an Existing Image Using DISM

segment.source: Add a second image to an existing .wim file.
segment.target: Add a second image to an existing .wim file.

segment.source: Create a Data Image Using DISM
segment.target: Create a Data Image Using DISM

segment.source: Create a .wim file that contains only files and applications that you intend to copy to the Windows installation by using an unattended answer file.
segment.target: Create a .wim file that contains only files and applications that you intend to copy to the Windows installation by using an unattended answer file.
